comments.body: Do we really want to use `_text` while it's still marked as unstable. This could potentially have an impact a number of DO modules if we begin to use this before it's stable.

We do.  I'm going to mark it stable for either 2.4 or 2.5.  The API has changed in only one subtle way in the past few releases (the default error handler changed from surrogate_or_replace to surrogate_then_replace as I found one cornercase where surrogate_or_replace could traceback).

the to_* methods make encoding issues and conversion from bytes and text much simpler than trying to ad hoc a solution.  And as a bonus, as long as it's marked unstable, I've been reviewing the code that uses it to make sure I fix them if I make any changes that would break (so far I've been lucky on that front.  the only things I've had to change were when I first introduced the functions and only a few things were using them).  Once I declare the interface stable I'll have to create new versions of the functions if I make backwards incompatible changes and then I'll rely more heavily on maintainers to port to new versions on a deprecation cycle.
